p: The minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) was used as an indicator of the antibacterial activity. For the MIC evaluation, the microdilution method that was previously outlined [ 70], was used. In addition to this method, we used resazurin to ease the visualization of bacterial growth in the wells of the microplate [ 71]. For the accuracy of the results, the extracts were first subjected to an evaporation step, to remove any trace of ethanol that could modify antibacterial activity.
